metadata.title: CVE-2022-21362 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Server: Information Schema). Supported versions that are affected are8.0.27 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows high privilegedattacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQLServer. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorizedability to cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) ofMySQL Server. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 4.9 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-21362` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.28-0ubuntu2
mysql-client - 8.0.28-0ubuntu2
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.28-0ubuntu2
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.28-0ubuntu2
mysql-router - 8.0.28-0ubuntu2
mysql-server - 8.0.28-0ubuntu2
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.28-0ubuntu2
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.28-0ubuntu2
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.28-0ubuntu2
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.28-0ubuntu2
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.28-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.28-0ubuntu2').
